Definition: An ear cyst is a sac-like pocket of tissue that can form in the ear canal or surrounding areas.
Causes: Blocked glands, infections, or genetic factors.
Symptoms: Pain, swelling, or discharge from the ear.
Treatment: Surgical removal or drainage if symptomatic.

Definition: Otitis media is an infection of the middle ear, often caused by bacteria or viruses.
Causes: Upper respiratory infections, allergies, and sinus infections.
Symptoms: Ear pain, fever, and irritability in children.
Treatment: Antibiotics, pain relievers, and sometimes ear tubes.

Definition: Ear infections can occur in the outer, middle, or inner ear and are often due to bacteria or viruses.
Causes: Infections, allergies, and fluid buildup.
Symptoms: Pain, discharge, and hearing loss.
Treatment: Antibiotics, pain management, and sometimes surgery.

Definition: An earache is pain in the ear that can result from various conditions.
Causes: Infections, injuries, or pressure changes.
Symptoms: Sharp, dull, or throbbing pain in the ear.
Treatment: Pain relievers, warm compresses, and treating underlying causes.

Definition: Eczema is a chronic inflammatory skin condition characterized by itchy, red, and dry skin.
Causes: Genetic factors, allergens, and irritants.
Symptoms: Itching, redness, and scaling of the skin.
Treatment: Topical corticosteroids, moisturizers, and avoiding triggers.

Definition: Empyema is a collection of pus in the pleural cavity, often due to infection.
Causes: Pneumonia, lung abscess, or chest trauma.
Symptoms: Chest pain, fever, and difficulty breathing.
Diagnosis: Imaging studies and analysis of pleural fluid.
Treatment: Antibiotics, drainage of the fluid, and sometimes surgery.

Definition: Endocarditis is an infection of the inner lining of the heart chambers and valves.
Causes: Bacterial or fungal infections, often from the bloodstream.
Symptoms: Fever, chills, and heart murmur.
Treatment: Intravenous antibiotics and sometimes surgery.

Definition: Endometrial cancer is a type of cancer that begins in the lining of the uterus.
Causes: Hormonal imbalances, obesity, and genetic factors.
Symptoms: Abnormal vaginal bleeding, pelvic pain, and weight loss.
Treatment: Surgery, radiation therapy, and chemotherapy.

Definition: Endometriosis is a condition where tissue similar to the lining of the uterus grows outside the uterus.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown, but may involve hormonal and genetic factors.
Symptoms: Pelvic pain, heavy periods, and infertility.
Treatment: Pain management, hormonal therapy, and surgery.

Definition: End-stage kidney disease is the final stage of chronic kidney disease where kidneys can no longer function.
Causes: Diabetes, hypertension, and glomerulonephritis.
Symptoms: Fatigue, swelling, and changes in urination.
Diagnosis: Blood tests, urine tests, and imaging.
Treatment: Dialysis or kidney transplantation.

Definition: Eosinophilic esophagitis is an allergic inflammatory condition of the esophagus.
Causes: Food allergies and environmental allergens.
Symptoms: Difficulty swallowing, food impaction, and chest pain.
Treatment: Dietary changes, medications, and sometimes dilation.

Definition: Epidermolysis bullosa is a group of genetic disorders that cause fragile skin and blistering.
Causes: Genetic mutations affecting skin structure.
Symptoms: Blistering, skin fragility, and pain.
Treatment: Wound care, pain management, and supportive therapies.

Definition: Epididymitis is the inflammation of the epididymis, often due to infection.
Causes: Bacterial infections, sexually transmitted infections, and trauma.
Symptoms: Pain and swelling in the scrotum.
Treatment: Antibiotics and pain relief.

Definition: Epilepsy is a neurological disorder characterized by recurrent seizures.
Causes: Genetic factors, brain injury, and infections.
Symptoms: Seizures, loss of consciousness, and confusion.
Treatment: Antiepileptic medications and lifestyle modifications.

Definition: Epithelioid sarcoma is a rare type of soft tissue sarcoma that typically occurs in young adults.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown, but may involve genetic mutations.
Symptoms: A firm lump or mass, often on the extremities.
Treatment: Surgery, radiation therapy, and chemotherapy.

Definition: Esophageal achalasia is a disorder where the esophagus has difficulty moving food into the stomach.
Causes: Nerve damage affecting esophageal muscle function.
Symptoms: Difficulty swallowing, regurgitation, and chest pain.
Treatment: Dilation, surgery, and medications.

Definition: Esophageal cancer is a type of cancer that occurs in the esophagus.
Causes: Smoking, heavy alcohol use, and certain dietary factors.
Symptoms: Difficulty swallowing, weight loss, and chest pain.
Treatment: Surgery, chemotherapy, and radiation therapy.

Definition: Esophagitis is inflammation of the esophagus, often due to acid reflux or infections.
Causes: Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), infections, and irritants.
Symptoms: Painful swallowing, chest pain, and heartburn.
Treatment: Medications to reduce acid and treat underlying causes.

Definition: Essential tremor is a nervous system disorder that causes involuntary shaking.
Causes: Genetic factors and environmental influences.
Symptoms: Tremors in the hands, arms, and head.
Treatment: Medications, lifestyle changes, and sometimes surgery.

Definition: Ewing's sarcoma is a rare type of cancer that occurs in the bones or soft tissue.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown, but it involves genetic mutations.
Symptoms: Pain, swelling, and fever.
Treatment: Chemotherapy, radiation therapy, and surgery.

Definition: Eye cancer refers to cancers that develop in the eye or surrounding tissues.
Causes: Genetic factors, UV exposure, and certain medical conditions.
Symptoms: Vision changes, eye pain, and visible growths.
Treatment: Surgery, radiation therapy, and chemotherapy.

Definition: Eye emergencies are urgent conditions that require immediate medical attention.
Causes: Injuries, infections, and sudden vision changes.
Symptoms: Severe pain, vision loss, and redness.
Treatment: Depends on the specific emergency; may include medications or surgery.

Definition: Eye floaters are small spots or lines that appear in a person's field of vision.
Causes: Aging, vitreous detachment, and eye injuries.
Symptoms: Seeing spots, cobwebs, or shadows in vision.
Treatment: Usually not required, but surgery may be needed in severe cases.

Definition: Eye melanoma is a type of cancer that develops in the melanocytes of the eye.
Causes: UV exposure and genetic factors.
Symptoms: Vision changes, dark spots in the eye, and eye pain.
Treatment: Surgery, radiation therapy, and sometimes chemotherapy.

Definition: An eye stroke occurs when blood flow to the retina is blocked, leading to vision loss.
Causes: Blood clots, atherosclerosis, and other vascular issues.
Symptoms: Sudden vision loss or blurriness in one eye.
Treatment: Depends on the cause; may include medications or surgery.

Definition: Eyelid tumors are abnormal growths on the eyelid that can be benign or malignant.
Causes: Sun exposure, genetic factors, and skin conditions.
Symptoms: Lump or growth on the eyelid, irritation, and changes in appearance.
Treatment: Surgical removal and monitoring.
